content.div:
We put our kissers to the test to find out which lip plumper could give us an Angelina Jolie pout. Find out which gloss flattened the competition and which ones left our lips less than luscious.



Smashbox O-Plump (Retails for $28. Available at Sehora)

“When evaluating the different beauty products each week, I have to remind myself to separate whether it’s a product I would have tried out on my own (as has been previously established) from whether the product works well. I think I’ve been mostly successful, but this time, I’m finding it impossible because I truly cannot understand why anyone would want to use these lip-plumping products – especially the Smashbox brand. It felt like I had lit my mouth on fire, people. On fire. My lips were burned for the better part of an hour, during which I prayed for the sweet release of death, and when it was over, my lips were so pink that it looked like I’d made out with a My Little Pony. I mean, I guess Smashbox promised pinker-looking lips, so the product worked, but why would anyone want this for themselves? Seriously, somebody tell me. Worst experience ever. Rating: 0 out of 5 – Kat Angus

“Apparently, to achieve that Angelina Jolie bee-stung look, you need to feel like your lips have actually been stung by bees. The first thing you’ll notice after applying O-Plump is a prickly, tingling sensation. That’s just a fun little precursor to the burning reaction you’ll soon be feeling – for about an hour. It’s not too painful, but you’ll definitely be conscious of your lips that entire time. Unfortunately, the burning didn’t translate into any sort of plumping for me. However, it did turn my lips a lovely shade of pink that looked natural and rosy. Also, despite not living up to its plumping promises, I loved the way it made my lips look and feel: soft, moisturized and shiny (if still a little on the thin side). I’ve actually started using it as a regular gloss – even though I bitch about the burning every time I apply it. Beauty is pain, people! Rating: 4 out of 5” – Jen McDonnell

“Promises, promises. O-Plump claimed it'd give me a Trouty Mouth worthy of Chord Overstreet and magically turn my lips their ‘own perfect shade of pink.’ I suppose a cotton-candy hue could be considered natural. (Aren't we girls made of sugar and spice? Plus, I've been known to have break-outs that colour.) As for the plumping, you win this round -- again -- Overstreet. My lips didn't get bigger (a disappointment this test has taught me to deal with). And they burned with the same tingly intensity -- and hour-long duration -- as with the Hard Candy goop. Where O-Plump makes up for its relatively pricier price-tag is the gloss itself. Smooth and light-weight -- but with ample shine -- it left my mouth feeling lusciously moisturized. It’s a small trade-off for feeling like I have pink jalapenos for lips. Rating: 3.5 out of 5” – Leah Collins

“If we were rating these lip plumpers based on the burning sensation alone, Smashbox O-Plump would be the clear winner. When I first applied this gloss, I immediately remembered why I stopped searching for the perfect plumper in the first place -- the pain! Despite the fact that my lips felt like they were on fire, I avoided wiping it off in hopes that major stinging meant major results. Unfortunately, I couldn’t really see a difference. On the plus side, the formula was moisturizing and did give my pucker the perfect pink hue. Rating: 3 out of 5" - Miranda Furtado


Hard Candy Fat Pout Lip Gloss (Retails for $4.68. Available at Wal-mart)

“Expect a fat pout -- but for all the wrong reasons. Despite a promise of ‘the biggest, sexiest lips possible without a doctor's visit,’ my kisser showed no signs of embiggening. It did, however, burn consistently for an hour. Nothing scary, kids; just imagine what it'd be like if Vick's VapoRub made a lipstick. That said, why would I put Vick's VapoRub on my mouth? (You know, unless I was trying out for TLC's My Strange Addiction.) As a gloss, Fat Pout is just as vanilla-frosting-yummy and sparkle-tween shiny as Hard Candy's $4 Plexi Gloss. Stick with that stuff, and save yourself from a bout of strange, tingly feelings. Rating: 3 out of 5” – Leah Collins

“This brand is consistently great when it comes to quality vs. price. Unfortunately, the Hard Candy Fat Pout Lip Gloss didn't live up to expectations. The only thing my lips gained was a harsh burning sensation -- with a vanilla frosting flavour. Lesson learned: you can't have your cake and eat it too. Rating 3 out of 5." - Miranda Furtado


Stila Plumping Lip Glaze (Retails for $24.00 Available at Sephora)

“Well, this one didn’t burn nearly as badly as the Smashbox brand, but Stila still made my lips tingle. Despite this, however, didn’t notice my pout looking any plumper than usual; a little pinker, sure, but unlike the Smashbox, this one has pink already in the gloss, so the slight tint isn’t that impressive. Stila might work perfectly well as a normal lip gloss, but the consistency was a bit too goopy for my taste. Rating: 2 out of 5” – Kat Angus

“This product burned a lot less than the Smashbox plumper. It certainly tingled upon application, but the sensation only lasted a few seconds. If I squinted really hard, I could sort of maybe see a slight plumping effect, but I wouldn’t expect anyone else to notice the difference. I liked the packaging and brush applicator (which allowed me to control the amount), and appreciated the very sheer sweep of colour it added to my lips, but its thick, goopy texture made it a mess to apply. Rating: 3 out of 5” – Jen McDonnell

“The Stila Plumping Lip Glaze was probably my favourite. While it didn't really plump up my pucker I can say that the tingle was bearable and did give my pout a pretty tint. I really liked the brush applicator and the twist-the-dial application. While it doesn't compare to the sweet, sweet taste of Hard Candy's vanilla frosting flavour, this one did come in close as a tasty treat. Rating: 3.5 out of 5" - Miranda Furtado


Annabelle Volumelip Lip Plumping Gloss (Retails for $8.50. Available at Shoppers Drugmart)

“Once again, Angelina Jolie will have you beat. Hell, the same goes for a lip-less Muppet. I'll admit my kisser looked bigger using Volumelip, but only because the tint (I scored a sample in a Ronald McDonald shade of red) tended to bleed a little around my lip line. Definitely not worth the effort, and believe me, I earned my "E." The cap is tricky to remove (try opening it without yanking the nib-like applicator clean off with it). And should you succeed, have fun squeezing a proper dollop of gloss from the hard-plastic tube. Once out, the gloss itself is average: moderate shine, smooth application. Pass. Rating: 2 out of 5” – Leah Collins

“Plumping? What plumping? Annabelle took the easy way out and skipped the plumping (and burning side effects) completely in exchange for a little colour. The only thing that this product offered was crushed dreams and a goopy smile. Rating: 1 out of 5" - Miranda Furtado

link.Abstract: We try before you buy! Dose.ca editors are playing guinea pigs to get the 411 on the latest beauty products. This week we've put five of our favourite hairspray brands to the test. Find out which one outlasted and outshined the competition.
link.title: Buy or Beware: Hairspray

link.Abstract: We try before you buy! Dose.ca editors are playing guinea pigs to get the 411 on the latest beauty products. This week, we're testing five popular brands of lipstick that promise a long-lasting perfect pout.
link.title: Buy or Beware: Long-Lasting Lip Colour

link.Abstract: This week, the Dose.ca team put some of our favourite nail polish brands to the test. Find out which ones lived up to their claim and which ones fell short of the competition.
link.title: Beauty Buy or Beware: Nail Polish

entry.content: We put some popular brands of lip gloss to the test. Find out which ones shone bright – and which ones made our puckers pout.

source.title: Beauty Buy or Beware: Lip Plumpers
source.subtitle: We put our kissers to the test to find out which lip plumper could give us an Angelina Jolie pout. Find out which gloss flattened the competition and which ones left our lips less than luscious.

link.title: Beauty Buy or Beware: Lip Plumpers
